en.sc1: Let's see how to find the closed form solution for $\displaystyle\sum_{i=0}^{n} 2^i$.
en.sc3.1: When $i = 0$, this adds $1$ to the summation. Represent this by a single rectangle.
en.sc4.1: When $i = 1$, this adds $2$ to the summation. Represent this by two rectangles.
en.sc5.1: When $i = 2$, this adds $4$ to the summation. Represent this by four rectangles.
en.sc6.1: When $i = 3$, this adds $8$ to the summation. Represent this by eight rectangles.
en.sc7.1: When $i = 4$, this adds $16$ to the summation. Represent this by 16 rectangles.
en.sc8.1: The closed form solution for this summation can be found by calculating the area of the resulting shape.
en.sc12: Now it is easy to see that the total area is $2^4 + 2^4 - 1 = 2^{4+1} - 1 = 31$.
